Node.definition: = referent to the time after the event in focus
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which someone becomes pregnant
= a male human

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= action by which humans and deities are actively engaged in pursuing the well being of people and/or objects
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= process by which a light bearing object gives out or reflects a bright light

= causative action by which humans cause a person, animal, or inanimate object that has become someone else's property to be restored to its original state, which is normally achieved by paying a price

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= causative process by which a specific event causes someone else to be in deep distress

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death
read יחד (יחד)

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state in which humans are unable to conceive a child

= causative action by which humans or deities consign humans to death, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

= to consign someone or something to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, anger, or hostility, or because one was hired to do so

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which someone is prepared for an event
= causative action by which someone causes someone else's inactivity to end so that he comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= large mythical monster living in the sea and looking like a giant croccodile or similar reptile

= process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: eyelids of the dawn; hence: = the earliest beginnings of the new morning
= causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a door (דֶּלֶת)
= something that provides or prevents access ◄ as if it were a door
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
literally: to go out (from the womb); hence: = process by which children are born

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

= action by which humans meet other humans that are travelling from one location to another ► either with good or with evil intentions; ≈ often extended to describe certain events that happen in people's lives
= central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= one of the breasts of a woman or other female mammal
= action by which newborn children drink milk from their mother's breasts
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be at ease|to be calm
Node.definition: = state in which humans feel confident and calm ◄ either because living under favorable circumstances or because of lack of fear when living under difficult circumstances
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= referent pointing to a specific condition or circumstance
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a person whose official role and responsibility it is to give advice to someone in authority

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= causative action by which humans desist from performing an event that has not yet started
= state in which the body of humans and animals shakes involuntarily, ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, excitement, or other emotions
= state in which humans have lost their strength as a result of laborious work which requires a lot of energy
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will

Node.gloss: to be at ease|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear
= state in which humans are of relatively low esteem
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= state of not being under the control of someone else
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: bitter; hence: = state in which humans are in deep distress

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to defer action|to wait|to lie in wait|to delay|to hesitate|to long
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state
= process by which humans or animals stop living

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: to dig for (something); hence: = state in which humans have a strong desire for something to happen
= objects of value that are usually kept invisible from others to keep them safe
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: to find the grave; hence: = process by which humans eventually die

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: road; hence: = a journey made for a specific purpose, usually on someone else’s behalf
= state in which certain information is not generally known, ◄ as if it were physically hidden
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
literally: to come; hence: = process by which things happen to someone ◄ as if it were a person coming to visit
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans are in a state of fear in the face of imminent danger

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be at ease|to be calm
Node.definition: = state in which humans feel confident and calm ◄ either because living under favorable circumstances or because of lack of fear when living under difficult circumstances
= state in which the body of humans and animals shakes involuntarily, ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, excitement, or other emotions
